Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: velmasa
Reviews.Content: Carpet is just too dirty for me, corners and space next to walls white with dust, mattress dirty. Changed room but same condition.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Zoidberg25
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when I'm in the area, which is somewhat frequently. It's your standard Sleep Inn: the rooms are spartan, but clean and comfortable. It has the usual "shower only" that all Sleep Inns have, but that doesn't affect me at all. Overall: It's a good price, the rooms are very adequate and it's right off of 695. There isn't much right in the area, but Glen Burnie is only a couple of miles away and you'll find tons of restaurants and the like there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is gross!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkcigarette
Reviews.Content: One elevator is out of service, ALL ice machines are broken. My room reeks of cigarettes, has some kind of white stain on each of the bedskirts, burn marks in all furniture and comforters, broken hvac unit that makes loud clunking noises when you turn it on, rust or some kind of red stain on the ceiling of the shower, burn marks and fraying in the rug, the toilet seat is so old the finish has literally worn off in several spots which are brown/black. On our first night we were awoken by screaming, laughing, etc. In the hall outside our room at 330am, we called the front desk and spoke to julie who told us someone was already on their way up here. The noise stopped... for about 5 mins. I called back at 4am due to continued noise, it did not stop until about 5am. Oh, and my dog found a partially drunk, expired (12/2011) bottle of bud light under the bed while we were gone, and when I checked I found more bottles under the bedskirt. Overall, this hotel is a catastrophe and I have pics to prove all of it! Customer service was terrible as well front desk staff did nothing to rectify the issue nor did the front desk manager Marcia.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: Hello, I'll give it a stab. We were on the 12/5 sailing of the Enchantment of the Seas and since the Comfort Inn is closed due to renovations we got moved next door to the Sleep Inn. First off the Hotel is very nice and in a nice location. When we checked in all the parking spots in front of the hotel were full so we waited until the next morning and as others came off their sailing we moved our vehicle to a spot in front of the lobby parking and had no problems whatssoever. The hotel was clean, comfortable and easy to get to the major highways. Since there were a large group of people going on the cruise there were always people in the lobby area talking, reading and socializing with each other. The breakfast was a continental breakfast and was constantly being replenished. The Front desk was kept quite busy and for the most part very pleasant. I did feel sorry for the staff in the morning when everyone was trying to sign up for the shuttle and also people trying to check out. As for the shuttle let's talk. The day we were leaving there were so many people downstairs waiting early. For the first hour there was only 1 shuttle running and then another drive came on so we had a total of 2 vans that held 10 people. One thing the hotel did was they would not let you sign up for the shuttle until you were checked out of your room. So since DH wanted to sleep in a little we didn't check out of the room until 9:45 and didn't get on the shuttle until 11:15. For me it wasn't that bad since I like to talk I found plenty of people from our roll call to converse with. Now coming back that's another story. We were told to not call the hotel until we were through Customs and had our luggage. So of course I did the opposite and called when we docked and asked for a number and was told it would be #5 so I thought no problem. Well after talking with the hotel I realized that it was 7:00 and our departure time was 8:20 - 8:40 and still had to go through customs and pick up luggage so I knew that no way would we make that so I told her to cancel our number and we'd call back later. I'm so glad we did. When we got off at 8:25 and went through everything it was approx. 8:55 and I called the hotel back and were were now #25. So we went out to wait and found friends of ours that had gotten off with the carry off luggage and had been waiting 1 1/2 hrs already and still had 5 more numbers to go until they could get on the shuttle. So I said forget it I'm not waiting and we got a taxi which cost us $30 w/o tip and we were back at the hotel by 9:30. I did go in and let the Hotel know to cancel our number and they were very appreciative since they had so many people still to load. Sorry this is so long but I wanted to give you all the details and unless you don't want to wait after the cruise take the taxi especially since it's cold outside and it's an open area. Hope this helps. Debbie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for park stay cruise”
Reviews.Author: MaureenUAllen
Reviews.Content: Best value for the money, it is not a luxury hotel, but it is a nice clean comfortable hotel and has the best value for the money. We booked a park and cruise package at this hotel, stayed a night in a clean comfortable room, parked our car for the cruise duration and hotel provided free shuttle to and from the cruiseport. We It was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “System double-booked my room”
Reviews.Author: PAMan804
Reviews.Content: When I checked-in, the "system" was down. They booked me via paper. Apparently they booked someone else in to my room because at 1:45 AM I was jolted awake by someone trying to get in my room. For some reason, this person persisted for several minutes trying to get in my room. I had to get out of bed and ask him to find another room. In the morning, there was no hotel bill under my door so I had to stop at the front desk. Nobody was at the front desk, so we had to find a clerk. When we finally found a clerk, she could not print a bill for me. She promised to email it, but I have yet to see it.

Reviews.Title: “Cars commonly burglarized in area”
Reviews.Author: j s
Reviews.Content: Don't be another victim. Cars commonly being burglarized even within 3 parking spots of the entrance under lights. Security camera "turned off". Plenty of nice hotels in the hotel district. Avoid this one. They are happy to call the police for you, but absolutely nothing else. Not worth the risk of $1,200+ car repair for a catalytic converter cut out from underneath your car. Avoid this hotel!!! Safe travels to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, But Close to Airport, Light Rail”
Reviews.Author: Railroadguy
Reviews.Content: this has been my 2nd or 3rd stay here, it is close to a light rail station, the hotel is outdated and needs a facelift, but the rooms are clean and quiet, staff is helpful, easy on and off access from 695, and free shuttle to airport, no resteraunts near by except for a fast food place across the street.It served my pupose this stay as I wanted to relax and take the train into the city for a evening of bars and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Fly a Plus ... hotel is average”
Reviews.Author: Chuck2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as part of a park-sleep-fly package for 8 days parking which was quite reasonably priced ... $119 Room was okay and large ... but, was dated Bathroom was large with a separate toilet room Large room ... small TV Not bad for the price and convenience to the airport

Reviews.Title: “STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: lostbird305
Reviews.Content: We are still waiting after 3 hours for someone to fix the toilet. The staff is worse than indifferent, they lie. Promised a room change, did not happen. Now waiting on the shuttle driver to come back and bring a plunger. The folks here no no care about their guests. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at best. Showing signs of wear. Questionable area”
Reviews.Author: YepBeenThere
Reviews.Content: At one time, this was likely a good property. Unfortunately this property is showing signs of wear and lack of care. Thread-bare carpet, dirty hallways and marred elevators show lack of maintenance. The room itself was adequate for the money. The bed was fine and the pillows were better than expected. Notice at front desk about vehicle theft makes me uneasy. This seems to be a rough area, although I didn’t have any problems. I would rate this a 6/10. I'm sure there are worse properties out there, but this is not a Fairfield, Hampton or HI Express level property. Very lame breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: slcruiser
Reviews.Content: We had reserved two rooms – one suite and Handicap room with a king bed, but we didn’t get either. We didn’t even get a handicap room. Even though we made our reservations through their website, the person at the front desk said they couldn’t give us the rooms we reserved. The front desk woman was very arrogant and not helpful. We asked for manager, but there wasn’t any there. We called “Choice customer desk” but received no satisfaction. Additionally, we had paid extra for Park and Ride for a cruise so we could leave our vehicle there and receive transportation to and from the cruise port. Upon return I called from Cruise port as directed. They said we were number S29. I asked what that meant and she said “That means there are a lot ahead of you”. That didn’t help me at all. One bus finally showed up but only took passengers from the Comfort Inn. After waiting 48 minutes outside in the cold with our luggage another bus finally showed up but took guest both Comfort and Sleep Inn. Since they were able to take appox 2 groups per van, we were going to have to wait 3-4 hours before they got to S29 (they were at group S21/22). The driver blamed the delay on heavy traffic. We finally got a van taxi and paid the extra $35 instead of waiting in the cold for hours. Its strange how there wasn’t any traffic problem when we were in the taxi. I also filled out the customer on-line survey and submitted it to Choice explaining how unhappy I was, but I didn’t receive any feedback. We will never never never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded in Baltimore... ended up here for the night”
Reviews.Author: parispeary
Reviews.Content: After finding out that I would either be sleeping on the airport floor, or paying to stay in a hotel, I opted to spend the money for a bed. I'd never been stranded in a city that I'd never been to let alone at midnight. I honestly had no idea what I was doing as I'd never reserved a hotel room before. The staff answered all of my rookie questions and did not try to take advantage of my lack of hotel knowledge. The room was mediocre. I only was here for about 5 hours and wanted to get as much sleep as possible. My only complaints are that you can hear EVERYTHING going on outside of your room which makes it a less than peaceful sleep... unless of course you're sleep deprived like me and can fall asleep in a rock concert and additionally... not the most comfortable beds and awkwardly tiny pillows.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY ATTROCIOUS”
Reviews.Author: angelian123
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE. The Sleep Inn is a terrible hotel, with terrible management and service. They messed up our hotel reservations, and failed to provide the necessary arrangements after we notified them of said mess ups. They will rip you off! We reserved a suite in this hotel months before, and upon arrival, we were informed that our room was unavailable and no suites were open. After complaining, they did nothing to accommodate us and were overall terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Sleep Inn at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: 4arleen
Reviews.Content: Carpet in room filthy dirty. Air conditioner unit falling apart, though working. Non-smoking room that smelled like smoke. Suspect bed bugs. Was bitten on upper arm during the night. Had a hotel blackout that lasted about an hour & a half at 10:30PM. Continental breakfast was lacking - no eggs, waffles, bananas or citrus fruit, just breads, cold & hot packaged cereals, juice, milk, coffee, tea. Hotel staff was very nonchalant.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP of a HOTEL ........ Un friendly front desk”
Reviews.Author: Lloydmbrown
Reviews.Content: This place should be AVOIDED at all cost !!! My wife and I stayed there on July 15th, 2010. The staff at the front desk was un-friendly at check-in. The T.V. in the room is not working and I called the front desk. He told me he was busy and could not repair. I asked him to send a mainanance to repair, he told be there was no one right now. I was very mad. SAVE your money try somewhere else,close to the airport.. THe place is not clean. The carpet in the rooms need cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Solid option if traveling in/out of BWI”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after arriving in late on a flight into Baltimore. Had an early morning meeting to attend so was really only at the hotel about eight or nine hours. Besides the hallway corridors being abnormally warm, I have no real complaints. Shuttle was kind of slow coming to the airport, but I gathered there was some construction and it was after midnight, after all. The room was pretty standard if you've ever stayed at Sleep Inn before. Bed was comfy, it had a nice walk-in shower, the area seemed both safe and quiet, but everything else about it was pretty basic. Continental breakfast in the morning was okay, nothing too special. I wouldn't go out of my way to return here but it's a perfectly decent 2 1/2 star airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Property, rooms filthy, front desk staff indifferent to issues”
Reviews.Author: capt71775
Reviews.Content: As an airline pilot, I stay here often, as my airline has a contract with this hotel. Given the choice, I would not stay here ever again. The rooms are basic, which is to be expected of a Sleep Inn, but the cleanliness left much to be desired. From toilets that were not scrubbed, to stains on the comforters, and body hair in the sheets, this was simply unacceptable to me. Even the linens and terry were beyond well worn and in desperate need of replacement. Mechanically, the room could use an overhaul. The window unit was noisy, the shower had very little pressure, and the furniture was showing its age. On the plus side, the breakfast is decent, and the van driver who drove us to and from the airport was friendly. Eating options are few, with a Checkers right across the street, and a full service restaurant with limited hours called "The Rose" within walking distance. Access to the metro may be your best bet!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: parsonssc
Reviews.Content: We went stayed on a park and cruise package. I expected a 2 star class hotel and would give it a 3 or higher. The room was very large and well made. A small problem with the toilet was fixed quickly and professionally. The staff was friendly and accomodating. Our cruise was delayed and they allowed several people to have a late checkout and then to congregate in the lobby until late in the evening. Their shuttle service was on time and the drivers were very friendly. I felt safe in the neighborhood and it was well located to restuarants etc. The only complaint was the breakfast was not on par with the rest of the hotel. I will stay at this property again if the need presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: noblesavage
Reviews.Content: The Sleep Inn and Suites is a very good selection for someone looking for a comfortable, clean and inexpensive option. There is the shuttle bus for BWI and the nearby light rail for going into Baltimore. It is not a luxury hotel, but that is not what I was looking for. If you're looking for deluxe accommodations you're probably looking in the Inner Harbor anyway. What I paid for three nights made it a great value. My only complaint is that the water pressure on the top floor was very weak- I got water, but ... Also, I expected the exhaust fan to work in the bathroom and one light was out (in the shower itself- no biggie). A routine check for these things and more general maintenance would put this hotel very high. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK - Hotel Shuttle Lost STROLLER - Manager Not Helpful”
Reviews.Author: sflinch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sleep Inn on Belle Grove Road numerous occasions for the Park N Fly package (also recommended to friends and family members), normally my experience has been fairly pleasant. But my last visit will be my last stay at this hotel, and also will make sure my friends and family avoid it also. I am VERY upset right now! The story is…...After returning from my trip @ 10:00 PM we called the hotel for the shuttle to pick us up, we were told to rush up the drop off area of the airport, or we would need to wait appx 40 minutes for the next shuttle to arrive. No problem, we get upstairs with a few minutes to spare. Shuttle arrives and we move our luggage (even though driver states, he will move it) and STROLLER (grandmother remembers)....specifically, putting stroller right with the luggage in the rear of the shuttle. Driver has numerous people to load, so he tells us to start boarding the shuttle, because he also has to pick up a flight crew at another spot in terminal, we all board the shuttle. And assume that all of our luggage and STROLLER are placed on the shuttle van. This is occurring at about 10:30 PM. So we get back to the hotel and he drops off some travelers at the door and proceeds to take us to our car (driver was very nice gentleman) he unloads are luggage and places it in the vehicle, as I am putting the baby car seat back into the vehicle, and loading my grandson. We all get home safely. Several days later, I called my daughter, because she traveled with us, and I again assume that she has the STROLLER, only to discover, she thinks I have the STROLLER. After discussing the scenario with each other, and our other traveling companion, we realize that the stroller never came off of the hotel shuttle van. So, now I contact the hotel and speak with a young lady at the front desk (did this for 2 1/2 days) while she contacted housekeeping and whoever else. Finally on the 3rd day, I was able to speak with a manager “Glen”, who took the information and stated he would check around and get back to me within 24 hours. 24 hours came and went with no word from Manager “Glen” so I proceeded to call him. Manager, pretty much told me, I am out of luck and there is nothing they can do for me, I should have made sure luggage and STROLLER were placed in van, instead of following the drivers orders, when driver stated to proceed getting on the van, so he could load up and move on. I should have ignored the driver, and made sure everything was placed inside of the van, prior to getting myself on the van. Manager was not very helpful nor apologetic about my situation. I recently purchased this Chicco STROLLER for my grandson, because it was more comfortable then your average umbrella stroller. I am now in the process of working with the airport in hopes that the stroller may have been turned in by a kind soul. IF the stroller was left sitting at the curb and did not make it on the van. I have no way of knowing if it did or not, due to Sleep in Suites, not being very helpful with the situation. Personally, I don’t think they did any research and did not care one way or the other about the missing STROLLER. And the manager…….in my experience of working with the public, has no people skills at all. Hopefully he was just having a BAD day, or he will lose a lot of business with his I don’t care attitude!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jodcha
Reviews.Content: Was there in Oct 2008 with a group, we booked 23 rooms. I found the staff very friendly and accommodating – even thou we have a large group. Group was happy. The only complain would be the lady working at the free breakfast area, she is a bit rude sometimes, but we didn’t mind her. The hotel is very basic, breakfast is not bad, bed is comfy, room is clean, washroom is clean, area is safe. The best is the close walking distancing to the light rail. I have been researching for different hotels in the BWI area and Sleep Inn seems to be the only hotel that is walkable distance to a light rail station – very convenient for us to travel to downtown. If you have a car and do not need the light rail, with the same budget, you will have a lot of options in the area. If you need the light rail and do not want to rely on the hotel shuttle to take you to a station, Sleep Inn is a good choice. We, as a group, will be going back this Oct and we are planning to stay in Sleep Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Low price means lower quality”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: Granted: this is a cheap hotel. Still, I thought it excessive that I was unable to sleep for three nights due to noisy neighbors. This is not normally a problem that I would blame on the hotel, except I was unable to switch rooms due to a fully booked hotel. Because my room had a suite door, it sounded like the noisy neighbors were in my own room. Oh well. Other than that, this hotel is what you would typically except for the price you pay: small stand alone shower, AC units that give off a funky smell, no room service, hard beds and non-existent pillows. Positives: my room had a mini fridge, free wifi and I got complimentary rides to and from the airport :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Leonje
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 3 friends for one night. I thought it was a great bargain. The room was very clean - even the bathroom. The decor was a bit dated, but pretty much what one would expect from this class of hotel. I was surprised that the hotel had an exercise room and free breakfast in the morning. Another nice surprise was the free wireless internet. The only real negative was that the walls were pretty thin, so I could hear the people in the next room in the wee hours of the morning. Overall, we had a good time there.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Services”
Reviews.Author: worstsepever
Reviews.Content: First off, it was nice of them to book me. We just arrived in BWI and there was still a room open. A slight positive, now onto the negatives. The room I was booked with had been used less than minutes after I moved in. A messed up bed, used towel on the other bed, and long black hair strewn about the sink. At the time I didn't mind, 28 hours of flying will do that to you. It was not until I left one of my shirts hanging up in the closet did I realize how bad this hotel was. After departing I realized I had left my shirt in the room. After having called I was told that they would call me back once they got a hold of room service. A day later I grew impatient and called once more. Their answer was 'we were not able to locate your shirt'. Keep in mind that it was in the closet on a hanger... now why they felt they needed to keep my top is beyond me. With their track record they probably just re booked the room without actually cleaning it. And the next tenant decided the shirt was a nice memento for his shoddy service. Whatever the case, their lack of care for room service is both unsanitary, and far from professional. I advise against booking with them, unless you like losing stuff you leave behind accidentally.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, safe area”
Reviews.Author: Free_State_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Sleep Inn BWI Airport, which is actually in Brooklyn, MD isn't a bad little hotel for traveling baseball fans. If you're going to an O's game try to get near the Inner Harbor, but if you can't get that close, this is a safe clean option. Baltimore can be extremely shady in some parts, but not this location. It is about 5 miles outside of the city right off 695. The Light Rail also has a station close by for commute to Camden Yards. The hotel was completely as advertised, pretty basic and clean, I honestly have no complaints and Im a complainer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous922
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the night in this hotel in July of 2008. We arrived at the hotel around 11:00 am, and they were gracious in letting us check in at that time! The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable! There was no bathtub, but the over-sized shower made up for that. We had a very relaxing stay at this hotel. We liked that Checkers was just across the street (we ate there), and there was also a Chinese restaurant within walking distance. Downtown Baltimore was also not far away. Overall, we enjoyed staying at the hotel that night, before our early flight out of BWI the next morning. We would most likely stay there again, if the opportunity would arise.

Reviews.Title: “Serves the Purpose”
Reviews.Author: produce592
Reviews.Content: Check-in was hassle-free. We arrived about an hour before the 3:00pm check-in, but the front desk person, Tiffany, had no problems with checking us in. The room was clean, but there was a small stain on one of the pillow cases, but since there was an abundance of pillows (9 in all), we just set that one aside. Wireless Internet reception was very good. No problems there; however, some of the TV channels, particularly ESPN, ESPN2, ESPNU, and ESPN Classic had unpredictable reception, much to my dismay. There were a fastfood restaurant and a gas satation/mini-mart withtin a one block walking distance of the hotel. If you do walk, be advised that there are no paved sidewalks. Also, when crossing the streets, you really have to hustle because traffic is very busy and dangerous. There is a Light Rail station also within one block of the hotel. It is very convenient to catch it to Orioles Park/Camden Yards. We chose to drive our car to the Yards, a mere 5 miles away. Overall, the stay was good; it served the purpose (Orioles Baseball game). We would in all likelihood stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it at all!”
Reviews.Author: MakingMemories317
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, Sleep Inn and Suites seemed like your average hotel. Once I checked into my room I found that the light bulb in the bathroom blew, the smoke detector was hanging out of the ceiling, and you could hear everything on both sides of you. I tried to order a movie to drown out my neighbors and the movies didn't work! I had to have it credited to my account because the screen kept jumping. Breakfast is a selection of bagels and cereals, no eggs, bacon or anything like that just in case that is what you think when you see the banners everywhere - they aren't for the hotel, they are for a restaurant next door, which you must pay for. In addition, the woman who keeps the breakfast area going was completely miserable, and stood in everyone's way as they were trying to get food, and then had the nerve to throw an attitude about people bumping into her. It was quite obvious to everyone that she hates her job! As if this isn't all bad enough, the front desk people were rude beyond belief. Everytime I called to ask them a question they acted as if I was inconveniencing them. The printer in the computer area was out of toner and I was told that "yep, they are waiting for it, don't know when it will be here" and that was that. One might think they would offer to let me use their copier or printer but that did not happen. I am military and was put up at this hotel while I awaited a flight to the Middle East for a deployment. My flight didn't leave until 9 at night. I asked if I could have a late, 4pm check out. I was told that I would have to pay for another night unless I checked out by 2. When I asked to speak to the manager I was told that the manager works 7-7 but at 11am had still not come in, that they show up when they feel like it. On top of that, she was very quick to tell me that the manager would tell me the same thing so there was no point in waiting to talk to anyone else. Apparently, despite their many yellow ribbons in support of the military, they could really care less about making my last experience before I leave a good one. They have tons of awards around for great customer service. All I can figure is that they have a friend on the awards board. This was a terrible experience and I hope that no other person, military or otherwise, has to experience the unacceptable service that I experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: Macksa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 311 and the refrigerator wasn't turned on. I didn't know that until Sunday morning when I took the food and drink that I purchased the previous night out of it. Needless to say, it was ruined. I gave the front desk worker the food so that she could see that the food was indeed warm coming directly from the refrigerator. Secondly, we had an adjoining room and th guests in the other room had children who were up before 8 a.m. and were really loud. Not only were the children loud, the parents (adults) were yelling at them. The front desk worker told me that someone else had made the same complaint. Lastly, I turned on the shower at 11:36 a.m. and the water did not get hot until 11:42 a.m. We called to the front desk, they said they would send someone up, but they never came. Not to mention that we didn't have an ironing board or iron in the room. Someone did come to bring one though. I voiced my complaints to the front desk clerk, who in turn gave me the General Manager's name. I called to speak with her and she told me I should've turned the refrigerator on. Now, I've never stayed in a hotel where I had to turn the refrigerator on, nor did anyone tell me that I had to. She then told me that she's stayed at many hotels and that she has had to turn the refrigerator on. I told her that's not important, but the fact is, I'd spent money on food that I couldn't eat. She put me on hold for five minutes. I called back and she told me she had an emergency at the front desk and that's why I was on hold so long. As we continued to talk. she then told me that while I was on hold she had gone to find the housekeeper who was on duty Sunday. She then took my name/number, asked me what room I had stayed in and told me she would go and check the refrigerator. Needless, to say I haven't heard from her since. Rooms were clean, but the service could definitely be better.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Pennsylvanina
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and left are car parked there for 6 days. We flew out of BWI. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are small but very clean. They had breakfast that was set up at 3:00 am, just juice, tea, coffee etc. muffins, cereal, toast etc, excellent fresh fruit. We was happy with that. The only thing was we had to stand in line to check in for at least 15 minutes. The shuttle runs every 30 minutes, it worked out fine for going and coming back. I will defintely stay there again if I was flying out of BWI.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Inn was no frills, but clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: panicked
Reviews.Content: An airline paid for me to spend the night at the Sleep Inn near BWI Airport after I was bumped off the last flight of the evening. They have a free 24-hour shuttle service to and from BWI that picks you up when you call them, and leaves the hotel on the hour and half hour. The Sleep Inn and the Comfort Inn are adjacent and share the same shuttle. I almost missed my shuttle pickup at BWI because the van was marked "Comfort Inn" on the front, and only had a small Sleep Inn icon on the side. Other than that, the shuttle service was fast and courteous. Sleep Inn is a couple of miles away from the airport, about a 7-10 minute drive. The employees at check-in were nice, and the lobby and public areas were clean and appeared newly renovated. There was a little business center with a couple of computers for guests to use. I think this hotel caters mostly to airline flight crew. The continental breakfast (a couple muffins, bagels, some cereal) started at 3:00 AM to accomodate people on early flights. My room was clean but spartan. The bathroom was spotless, and came with some shampoo, lotion, a couple bars of soap, and some thin towels. The bed and linens were clean and comfortable. The HVAC system was loud, and the room was somewhat musty when I first arrived. I appreciated the free wireless internet, although I had some problems with connectivity, probably due to my room location at the very end of the building. There was a mini-fridge and a coffee maker in the room. I was looking for dinner at 11:00 PM, so the desk clerk recommended Rose's and gave me a coupon for 10% off. Rose's is in the same complex as the Comfort Inn/Sleep Inn. They have late-night food and a lounge (I think the kitchen closed around midnight or 12:30?), but a very limited menu after 10:30. Other than Rose's, only a Checkers burger stand and a gas station were within walking distance. I felt a little uncomfortable walking around the area at that hour. I would be unlikely to stay here again unless the rate was very cheap, or I had an extremely early flight. For a place to crash, it's perfectly adequate, and there are some nice touches for the odd schedules of air travelers.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: missthing25
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay in this hotel, me and boyfriend both stayed for one night for the new years and it was clean, everything went fine. The customer service was excellent. I didn't have any problems, the only thing that I disliked about our room was the tv, and the free breakfast was jus blah!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to Light Rail”
Reviews.Author: vter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Mid-September to visit Baltimore and see the Red Sox vs. Orioles. We picked the hotel due to it's convenience to the North Linthicum Light Rail Station. The station is just down the road from the hotel - easy walking distance. Not much else in the area, especially for restaurants. The hotel itself was nice and quiet. Breakfast was plentiful. Two computers with internet access was a plus. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel three times since it opened a few years ago. It has really gone down hill. The first time was our best stay at this hotel, everyone was friendly and the reservation request was exactly what we wanted. However, the send time the breakfast buffet had nothing on it except for a few muffins, they were out of OJ, and the tables to sit around were very dirty. When we arrived back from our trip we called twice for the shuttle and waited over a 1/2 an hour and they never came, we ended up taking a taxi. This last time we stayed we requested a non-smoking room and we got smoking, when we asked to switch rooms, they said they were booked. When we checked in the girl at the desk was on a personal call and didn't get all our infirmation, when you leave your car at the hotel you have to fill out some additional information, which I knew from my previous stays. The breakfast buffet was just ok, this time, not enough ice around the milk it was warm. When we returned from our trip we waited again about 30 minutes and the shuttle finally came, then he circled the airport until the shuttle was full. Which ment a 10 minute trip turned into another 30 to 40 minutes. I'm sure there is a nicer hotel for the value in the BWI area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff and corporate attitude”
Reviews.Author: SydneyB
Reviews.Content: Stay away! Very nice property and convenient, but front desk staff had HORRIBLE attitude. I booked over the internet, called for Park and Fly info, and was told I could get the internet rate, then pay an extra $20 for parking...Great Deal, right?? WRONG. Once we got there the front desk clerk argued with us for about 15 minutes, basically saying that we were not supposed to KNOW about that rate; that it's really only for people who decide at the last minute it's better to park there than at BWI. She really had a BAD attitude, one of the worse I had ever encountered staying ANYWHERE. The stay itself was okay, although breakfast was little to nothing to speak of. But to make matters worse, we rec'd one of those e-mail "How was your stay" surveys from Choice Hotels (parent of Sleep Inn); to which we responded in detail about our unpleasant experience, to which their response was....nothing. Nada. No response whatsoever. Now THAT"s a bad sign!! I will gladly take my travel dollars elsewhere!

HotelInfo.Name: Sleep Inn & Suites Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 6055 Belle Grove Rd., Baltimore, MD 21225
